name: Demon's Winter
description:
The land of Ymros was first encountered in Shard of Spring, and it returns in this follow up, which is viewed from above, but has a game-world 32 times the size of its predecessor. Your characters can include Humans, Elves, Dwarves and Trolls, each with different skills as well as generated and varying statistics, and one of 10 different character classes - Barbarian, Wizard and Scholar for Example. You will need to choose the right balance of these for your mission, which involves tracking down Malifon and gain revenge on the damage he has done to Ymros.

Combat takes place via close-quarters combat and spell-casting, depending on the character's abilities. Towns can be visited to buy weapons, and you can return to your camp to worship one of the various Gods and receive their gifts such as resurrection and protection. It has also a 'skill/item' menu in which items can be used on other items to solve problems.
alsoFor: Apple II, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS | Combined View

shot.caption: Title screen
Options screen
The character utilities option lets you make new characters and add or remove them from your party.
Starting out a new game. There is a day/night cycle, when it's dark out your range of vision is limited. Here it's morning and becoming brighter.
Random encounters happen as you travel the map. To the south you can see a temple.
Combat takes place on a tactical screen. Positioning is important, if you are facing your team mate, nothing will stop you from attacking and killing your own characters!
Defeated the monsters and received gold, experience and a piece of loot.
There are temples for the various gods. Each of your character's can only worship one.
Outside a town.
Towns are displayed strictly in text. Options vary from town to town.
Checking out the weapons available for sale.
Crossing a bridge to go to the college that trains the "view world" ability. Sadly I can't afford it.
You can camp to spend the night safely.
Some towns have healers which can restore your party's health or resurrect fallen members.
Different temple priests have their own images.
You can ask around for information in town pubs.
Entering a dungeon.
Fighting inside the dungeon. The tactical map reflects the terrain you were in when you began combat.
To level up your characters, you have to visit a guild.
Some fixed location encounters announce themselves with a text description.
All other party members are dead and the last man standing is surrounded!
Alas, though he fought valiantly, he was overcome.
